Package algorithms.search

Class KDTree

java.lang.Object
algorithms.search.KDTree
public class KDTree extends Object
k-dimension tree is a binary tree used to store coordinates for quick nearest neighbor or range searches. -- values are always stored in leaves -- the meaning of an internal node depends upon the depth of the node within the tree. Note that learning the true medium while constructing the tree takes more time, but leads to a better balanced tree. adapted from pseudocode from http://ldots.org/kdtree which licenses the content as: http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0/ useful reading regarding best distances in nearest neighbor search: http://web.stanford.edu/class/cs106l/handouts/assignment-3-kdtree.pdf construction is O(N*log_2(N)) queries are: O(log_2(N)) to O(sqrt(N) + k)? need to revisit code to estimate this... first implemented in project https://github.com/nking/curvature-scale-space-corners-and-transformations w/ Copyright (c) 2014 Climb With Your Feet and using The MIT License (MIT) then moved to this shared library project which has the same copyright 
   mem is in MB:

    • reduceToUniqueWithMoveUp

      static int reduceToUniqueWithMoveUp(int[] x, int[] y)
      remove non-unique values by moving up items underneath them. returns the last index which should be used in the modified arrays given as arguments.
      Parameters:
      x - x coordinates
      y - y coordinates
      Returns:
      the number of items to use in the modified x and y arrays which have only unique pairs in them now.

    • partitionByX

      int partitionByX(int[] x, int[] y, int startSortRange, int stopSortRangeExclusive)
      sort by x and return index of median x value for which all points below are less than median x and .geq. for all points above median x index, in other words for indexes : 0 .lt. index have values x .lt. x[index] where x[index] is median x. for indexes : index .lte. n have values x .gte. x[index] where x[index] is median x.
      Parameters:
      x - x coordinates
      y - y coordinates
      startSortRange -
      stopSortRangeExclusive -
      Returns:
      index that divides the arrays as x .lt. median value and x .geq. median value

    • partitionByY

      int partitionByY(int[] x, int[] y, int startSortRange, int stopSortRangeExclusive)
      sort by y and return index of median y value for which all points below are less than median y and .geq. for all points above median y index, in other words for indexes : 0 .lt. index have values y .lt. y[index] where y[index] is median y. for indexes : index .lte. n have values y .gte. y[index] where y[index] is median y.
      Parameters:
      x - x coordinates
      y - y coordinates
      startSortRange -
      stopSortRangeExclusive -
      Returns:
      index that divides the arrays as y .lt. median value and y .geq. median value

    • buildTree

      protected KDTreeNode buildTree(int depth, int[] x, int[] y, int startSortRange, int stopSortRangeExclusive)
      build a tree at from given depth for x, y points using a depth-first algorithm. Exits from the recursion when npoints = 0, 1 or a leaf.
      Parameters:
      depth - depth from which to build tree
      x - x coordinates
      y - y coordinates
      startSortRange - index start range to use in partition
      stopSortRangeExclusive - index stop range to use in partition
      Returns:
      tree
